Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2011 12:32PM zanoza wrote: Hi girls, I was supposed to start the neo-adjuvant chemo tomorrow but it got delayed till all tests results are available. Reading all your posts are so promissing, I think I feel better now since I was concerned about not getting surgery right away. Thanks for the positive information!
Posts.Title: neoadjuvant chemotherapy and staging ReadingMama Shari0707

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2011 04:10PM zanoza wrote: Hi girls, Just spoke with a cousin who is oncologist in Germany. She said that they tell their patients to avoid vit.D since it feeds cancer!!!  Looks like nobody really knows anything about cancer yet Just thought that you might want to know more opinions...
Posts.Title: Vitamin D deficiency? ByFaith zanoza

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2012 05:50AM zanoza wrote: Hi lostinmo, on the top of your screen there is a black line with few topics in white. Click on "Symptoms & Diagnosis", then in the left upper corner click on "Your diagnosis" link. In the new screen that opens you'll see all info you need on the left broken up by topics.
Posts.Title: I tried, but I don't get it.. lostinmo lago

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2011 08:22PM zanoza wrote: {{{{{{{{{{Rockym}}}}}}}}}}}} we all know how scary and overwelming wating is. I'm waiting for the results of my THIRD biopsy (in the last month). My images were so bad the surgeon and onc had no doubt that it's an advanced BC, but 2 biopies came as DCIS, had the third one on the 10th. Yes, it's still BC but a way different. Accepting the dx and reconciling yourself with it is the hardest, but it'll be easier after. It's great you found this site, you can get all support and understanding here. I also add my prayers for you to be in that 5%!!!!
Posts.Title: Waiting For Biopsy Results :-( Rockym Sereena

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2011 02:07PM zanoza wrote: michelleo13 - re:oncotype test in Canada. My onc. told me that this test is done for everybody stage I & IIa (no node involvement) who is hormone positive. Lucky girls like us (hormone negative) get chemo automatically. I'm still on vacation, finally told my parents about my diagnosis (3 months after the fact). Trying to get ready for the next week start...Thanks a lot to everyone for the invaluable info about your treatments, it really makes waiting easier. I pray for as little SE for everyone in this wonderful group as possible.
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2011 04:48PM zanoza wrote: Hi girls, Just checking in to say that I,m back from #1AC tx. Went fine, just burning in my nose and REALLY heavy head. My DH says it's just too much brain in it Even finding a vein part went well, will have my port in on Sep. 2nd so next tx should be easier. Thanks a lot for all of you for sharing the experience, the nurse in the chemo room even thought that I was a nurse myself because I easily understood everything she was talking about. I think we can do those chemo teaching classes after being on this site. Welcome to all new ladies and good luck to everybody!
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2011 06:45PM zanoza wrote: Hi girls, May I join as well? 'll be starting on August 24th - 4 DD of AC then 4 DD of Taxol. I was supposed to start beginning of June but plans have changed and I had the MX first.Leaving on a 2-week vacation next Saturday, so chemo is being delayed till the 24th which is not too bad as I still have some fluid around the scar. Can't say that I'm really exited, but glad to have such a great company on the journey.Good luck to everybody!
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2011 09:13PM zanoza wrote: Musicalmom & Madismommy - thanks for the worm welcome leighsa - my onc. said up to 12 weeks after the surgery is still fine for the chemo waiting, but it depends on the actual characteristics of your cancer, my co-worker had to start 5 weeks after surgery because hers was spreading really fast and 15 of 17 nodes were positive.  Madismommy - I would ask your onc. why he chose exactly that combination/duration of chemo, he/she should be able to give you the clear explanation. This is what I did with mine anyway... I'm kinda person who asks a lot and I really don't like doing something I don't understand. My onc. even said that after my appointment his tongue was hurting
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2011 09:14AM zanoza wrote: Taylor777 - regarding pain during infusion. I did have some minor pain during A pushing-in, but the nurse wrapped my arm in a worm blanket and it went away pretty quickly. Just keep in mind this might help. Jbagley - my fatigue is overwhelming as well. It's the most terrible thing for me so far, not being able to move just sucks. And I really have to work but don't see how so far... Even hair loss is not bugging me as much as tiredness.  Regarding nails problems - I was told it's a possible side effect of Taxol (Taxotere is even more), AC shouldn't have his problem.
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2011 02:53PM zanoza wrote: Celine - I see you're HER+ which means a year of Herceptin, so port is a really good solution for you. PICC lines work for the short term cycles. I just had my port in today, so far so good, they even didn't prescribe any pain-killers, looks like in Canada we're getting less drugs Good luck for everybody getting treatment today, pray for as little SE for all of us as possible! I'm day 10 after the first tx and STILL nauseated
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2011 02:54PM zanoza wrote: WOW girls! I can't keep up with all posts coming:) Today is day 3 for me and I'm still very nauseous. It hit me 4 hours after tx and was pretty bad... At least i'm not throwing up any more (and really happy for that). Just a silly question  - what do you girls eat when you don't feel good? I'm not able to put anything in me and don't think it's a good thing. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated. JMULL - the burning nose was from the C component, I was told it's pretty common.
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie
August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2011 06:39PM zanoza wrote: JMULL - count me in for headaches and crazy dreams! I had really bad headache days 1-4 (no zofran) and REALLY crazy dreams up to day 6 (I don't take any meds for sleeping). I remember the first night after the normal sleep I was so happy those went away! I was afraid to ask about that so thanks a lot for asking and TG I'm not out of my mind yet My second one is on Wednesday as well and our daughter starts university on Thursday but at least she's 18
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2011 08:06PM zanoza wrote: Hi girls! I've been reading every day but not so much a writer, but I'm thinking of all of you all the time and so glad we ave this wonderful group! Day 2 for me after the second AC. They changed my anti-nausea meds and it's working! Nothing comparing to the last tx. I've been able to eat and drink and even went for a walk today! Thinking about going to work tomorrow, but will see how I feel in the morning... regarding AC vs. TC I was told that AC is very aggressive and always considered for the pre-meno ladies as it hits cancer's ass the hardest. fine with me as I really want to be around for years. Wishing everybody as minimal SE as possible and we WILL get through this together!
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2011 08:37AM zanoza wrote: Hi girls, Thanks a lot for your meal ideas, will try some. I've been taking kytril, dexamethasone & stemetil for nausea. It looks like every onc. prescribes his own meds. I'll try asking about other drugs that you're all taking, maybe those will work better. Today is day 4 and I'm supposed to stop all anti-nausea drugs but don't feel like it. Plus that terrible headache... Sorry for venting but I really didn't expect it to hit that fast and that bad.
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2011 08:49AM zanoza wrote: Good luck Taylor and Madismommy!!! Being one shot closer is a REALLY nice thing!  Taylor - from everything I heard, after AC is done, Taxol is just a breeze (I'm on the same treatment plan as you). So let's hang on for 8 weeks of AC. Taxotere is similar to Taxol, but has worth SE (there is a thread here somewhere called Taxoterrible, try not reading it)
